citation.article-title: Leifsonia pindariensis sp. nov., isolated from the Pindari glacier of the Indian Himalayas, and emended description of the genus Leifsonia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Leifsonia Evtushenko et al. 2000
Leifsonia (Leif.so′ni.a. N.L. fem. n. Leifsonia named after Einar Leifson, who isolated and described the first organism of this genus).
Cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, rod-shaped or filamentous, obligately aerobic and catalase-positive.
Cell-wall peptidoglycan is of B-type and contains DAB as the diamino acid and the major menaquinone is MK-11.
Principal phospholipids are phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol and the major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
The G+C content of the DNA ranges from 66 to 73 mol%.
The genus is a member of the family Microbacteriaceae of the order Actinomycetales. Leifsonia aquatica is the type species.
